  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** 32-bit integers.

  18.    This module provides operations on the type [int32]
  19.    of signed 32-bit integers.  Unlike the built-in [int] type,
  20.    the type [int32] is guaranteed to be exactly 32-bit wide on all
  21.    platforms.  All arithmetic operations over [int32] are taken
  22.    modulo 2{^32}.

  24.    Performance notice: values of type [int32] occupy more memory
  25.    space than values of type [int], and arithmetic operations on
  26.    [int32] are generally slower than those on [int].  Use [int32]
  27.    only when the application requires exact 32-bit arithmetic.

  29.     Literals for 32-bit integers are suffixed by l:
  30.     {[
  31.       let zero: int32 = 0l
  32.       let one: int32 = 1l
  33.       let m_one: int32 = -1l
  34.     ]}
  35. *)

  37. ‌val zero : int32
  38. (** The 32-bit integer 0. *)

  40. ‌val one : int32
  41. (** The 32-bit integer 1. *)

  43. ‌val minus_one : int32
  44. (** The 32-bit integer -1. *)

  46. external neg : int32 -> int32 = "%int32_neg"
  47. (** Unary negation. *)

  49. external add : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_add"
  50. (** Addition. *)

  52. external sub : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_sub"
  53. (** Subtraction. *)

  55. external mul : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_mul"
  56. (** Multiplication. *)

  58. external div : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_div"
  59. (** Integer division. This division rounds the real quotient of
  60.    its arguments towards zero, as specified for {!Stdlib.(/)}.
  61.    @raise Division_by_zero if the second
  62.    argument is zero.  *)

  64. val unsigned_div : int32 -> int32 -> int32
  65. (** Same as {!div}, except that arguments and result are interpreted as {e
  66.     unsigned} 32-bit integers.

  68.     @since 4.08 *)

  70. external rem : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_mod"
  71. (** Integer remainder.  If [y] is not zero, the result
  72.    of [Int32.rem x y] satisfies the following property:
  73.    [x = Int32.add (Int32.mul (Int32.div x y) y) (Int32.rem x y)].
  74.    If [y = 0], [Int32.rem x y] raises [Division_by_zero]. *)

  76. val unsigned_rem : int32 -> int32 -> int32
  77. (** Same as {!rem}, except that arguments and result are interpreted as {e
  78.     unsigned} 32-bit integers.

  80.     @since 4.08 *)

  82. val succ : int32 -> int32
  83. (** Successor.  [Int32.succ x] is [Int32.add x Int32.one]. *)

  85. val pred : int32 -> int32
  86. (** Predecessor.  [Int32.pred x] is [Int32.sub x Int32.one]. *)

  88. val abs : int32 -> int32
  89. (** [abs x] is the absolute value of [x]. On [min_int] this
  90.    is [min_int] itself and thus remains negative. *)

  92. val max_int : int32
  93. (** The greatest representable 32-bit integer, 2{^31} - 1. *)

  95. val min_int : int32
  96. (** The smallest representable 32-bit integer, -2{^31}. *)


  99. external logand : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_and"
  100. (** Bitwise logical and. *)

  102. external logor : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_or"
  103. (** Bitwise logical or. *)

  105. external logxor : int32 -> int32 -> int32 = "%int32_xor"
  106. (** Bitwise logical exclusive or. *)

  108. val lognot : int32 -> int32
  109. (** Bitwise logical negation. *)

  111. external shift_left : int32 -> int -> int32 = "%int32_lsl"
  112. (** [Int32.shift_left x y] shifts [x] to the left by [y] bits.
  113.    The result is unspecified if [y < 0] or [y >= 32]. *)

  115. external shift_right : int32 -> int -> int32 = "%int32_asr"
  116. (** [Int32.shift_right x y] shifts [x] to the right by [y] bits.
  117.    This is an arithmetic shift: the sign bit of [x] is replicated
  118.    and inserted in the vacated bits.
  119.    The result is unspecified if [y < 0] or [y >= 32]. *)

  121. external shift_right_logical : int32 -> int -> int32 = "%int32_lsr"
  122. (** [Int32.shift_right_logical x y] shifts [x] to the right by [y] bits.
  123.    This is a logical shift: zeroes are inserted in the vacated bits
  124.    regardless of the sign of [x].
  125.    The result is unspecified if [y < 0] or [y >= 32]. *)

  127. external of_int : int -> int32 = "%int32_of_int"
  128. (** Convert the given integer (type [int]) to a 32-bit integer
  129.     (type [int32]). On 64-bit platforms, the argument is taken
  130.     modulo 2{^32}. *)

  132. external to_int : int32 -> int = "%int32_to_int"
  133. (** Convert the given 32-bit integer (type [int32]) to an
  134.    integer (type [int]).  On 32-bit platforms, the 32-bit integer
  135.    is taken modulo 2{^31}, i.e. the high-order bit is lost
  136.    during the conversion.  On 64-bit platforms, the conversion
  137.    is exact. *)

  139. val unsigned_to_int : int32 -> int option
  140. (** Same as {!to_int}, but interprets the argument as an {e unsigned} integer.
  141.     Returns [None] if the unsigned value of the argument cannot fit into an
  142.     [int].

  144.     @since 4.08 *)

  146. external of_float : float -> int32
  147.   = "caml_int32_of_float" "caml_int32_of_float_unboxed"
  148.   [@@unboxed] [@@noalloc]
  149. (** Convert the given floating-point number to a 32-bit integer,
  150.    discarding the fractional part (truncate towards 0).
  151.    If the truncated floating-point number is outside the range
  152.    \[{!Int32.min_int}, {!Int32.max_int}\], no exception is raised, and
  153.    an unspecified, platform-dependent integer is returned. *)

  155. external to_float : int32 -> float
  156.   = "caml_int32_to_float" "caml_int32_to_float_unboxed"
  157.   [@@unboxed] [@@noalloc]
  158. (** Convert the given 32-bit integer to a floating-point number. *)

  160. external of_string : string -> int32 = "caml_int32_of_string"
  161. (** Convert the given string to a 32-bit integer.
  162.    The string is read in decimal (by default, or if the string
  163.    begins with [0u]) or in hexadecimal, octal or binary if the
  164.    string begins with [0x], [0o] or [0b] respectively.

  166.    The [0u] prefix reads the input as an unsigned integer in the range
  167.    [[0, 2*Int32.max_int+1]].  If the input exceeds {!Int32.max_int}
  168.    it is converted to the signed integer
  169.    [Int32.min_int + input - Int32.max_int - 1].

  171.    The [_] (underscore) character can appear anywhere in the string
  172.    and is ignored.
  173.    @raise Failure if the given string is not
  174.    a valid representation of an integer, or if the integer represented
  175.    exceeds the range of integers representable in type [int32]. *)

  177. val of_string_opt: string -> int32 option
  178. (** Same as [of_string], but return [None] instead of raising.
  179.     @since 4.05 *)


  182. val to_string : int32 -> string
  183. (** Return the string representation of its argument, in signed decimal. *)

  185. external bits_of_float : float -> int32
  186.   = "caml_int32_bits_of_float" "caml_int32_bits_of_float_unboxed"
  187.   [@@unboxed] [@@noalloc]
  188. (** Return the internal representation of the given float according
  189.    to the IEEE 754 floating-point 'single format' bit layout.
  190.    Bit 31 of the result represents the sign of the float;
  191.    bits 30 to 23 represent the (biased) exponent; bits 22 to 0
  192.    represent the mantissa. *)

  194. external float_of_bits : int32 -> float
  195.   = "caml_int32_float_of_bits" "caml_int32_float_of_bits_unboxed"
  196.   [@@unboxed] [@@noalloc]
  197. (** Return the floating-point number whose internal representation,
  198.    according to the IEEE 754 floating-point 'single format' bit layout,
  199.    is the given [int32]. *)

  201. ‌type t = int32
  202. (** An alias for the type of 32-bit integers. *)

  204. ‌val compare: t -> t -> int
  205. (** The comparison function for 32-bit integers, with the same specification as
  206.     {!Stdlib.compare}.  Along with the type [t], this function [compare]
  207.     allows the module [Int32] to be passed as argument to the functors
  208.     {!Set.Make} and {!Map.Make}. *)

  210. ‌val unsigned_compare: t -> t -> int
  211. (** Same as {!compare}, except that arguments are interpreted as {e unsigned}
  212.     32-bit integers.

  214.     @since 4.08 *)

  216. ‌val equal: t -> t -> bool
  217. (** The equal function for int32s.
  218.     @since 4.03 *)

  220. ‌val min: t -> t -> t
  221. (** Return the smaller of the two arguments.
  222.     @since 4.13
  223. *)

  225. ‌val max: t -> t -> t
  226. (** Return the greater of the two arguments.
  227.     @since 4.13
  228. *)

  230. ‌val seeded_hash : int -> t -> int
  231. (** A seeded hash function for 32-bit ints, with the same output value as
  232.     {!Hashtbl.seeded_hash}. This function allows this module to be passed as
  233.     argument to the functor {!Hashtbl.MakeSeeded}.

  235.     @since 5.1 *)

  237. ‌val hash : t -> int
  238. (** An unseeded hash function for 32-bit ints, with the same output value as
  239.     {!Hashtbl.hash}. This function allows this module to be passed as argument
  240.     to the functor {!Hashtbl.Make}.

  242.     @since 5.1 *)
